etymology.description: 宠(cherish; pamper) + 物(thing; creature) = pampered creature (pet).
etymology.interpretation: Emphasizes an animal kept and indulged by people. Connotes affection beyond mere ownership.
etymology.simplification: 寵 simplified to 宠 by replacing the complex 龍+心 with the simplified component 龙 under 宀 to reduce strokes; 物 unchanged.

parts.english: to dote on; to favor; to pamper; favored

examples.chinese: 我养了一只狗作为宠物(我養了一隻狗作為寵物)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǎng le yì zhī gǒu zuòwéi chǒngwù.
examples.english: I keep a dog as a pet.

examples.chinese: 许多人把宠物当作家人(許多人把寵物當作家人)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔduō rén bǎ chǒngwù dàngzuò jiārén.
examples.english: Many people treat pets as family members.

examples.chinese: 这家店提供宠物美容服务(這家店提供寵物美容服務)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā diàn tígōng chǒngwù měiróng fúwù.
examples.english: This shop provides pet grooming services.
